decks.notes: The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures and using burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The key strategy is to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures like Doorkeeper Thrull, Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, and Scion of Draco. The deck also utilizes counterspells like Stubborn Denial to protect its threats and disrupt opposing strategies. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support by boosting the power of multicolored creatures and locking down enemy permanents. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through a combination of creature damage and direct burn spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to deal damage to the opponent. With cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride boosting the team's power, combined with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. Seasoned Pyromancer provides card advantage while Ranger-Captain of Eos and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker offer utility. Blood Moon and Static Prison disrupt the opponent's mana base while cards like Thraben Charm provide additional removal options.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of disruptive creatures and versatile spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. By playing aggressive threats like Quantum Riddler and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, as well as disruptive creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. Support cards like Consign to Memory and Teferi, Time Raveler help with tempo advantage and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plays while building a board presence to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly and aggressively dealing damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient spells and creatures. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent before they can establish a strong defense. The deck also includes cards like Preordain and Mishra's Bauble to help maintain card advantage and ensure a consistent flow of threats. With a mix of burn spells and versatile creatures, this deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring powerful creatures like Elesh Norn and Griselbrand back from the graveyard to the battlefield for a quick win. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to control the opponent's game plan. The creatures in the deck like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, Psychic Frog, and Quantum Riddler provide additional value and synergies to help the deck combo off efficiently and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and Consign to Memory to manipulate your opponent's deck, you can keep your opponent on the back foot. Combined with efficient removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Lightning Bolt, as well as powerful creatures like Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, you can quickly close out the game. The deck also has some recursion with Ephemerate and card advantage with cards like Quantum Riddler and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker.

The deck is focused on utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly put pressure on the opponent. It includes a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to both control the opponent's board and finish the game. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card advantage and help set up the next turn. The goal is to be aggressive and fast-paced, using both creatures and burn spells to push through damage and win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Boros aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to establish early board presence with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, supported by Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines and Voice of Victory. Removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment help control the opponent's board while burn spells provide reach to close out the game. The sideboard options like Blood Moon and Static Prison provide additional disruption to deal with different strategies.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista. It also utilizes the synergies between cards like Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief to create a strong board presence. The deck has a mix of removal spells like Unholy Heat and Kozilek's Command to control the board while also utilizing cards like Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple help accelerate the deck's game plan, while cards like Ancient Stirrings provide card selection to find key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and efficient removal spells.

The deck focuses on generating massive amounts of mana with Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga to power out combo pieces like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker. The goal is to buff up creatures with Blade of the Bloodchief, ramp into Emrakul, the Promised End, and disrupt opponents with Kozilek's Command and Unholy Heat. The deck also utilizes Eldrazi lands and color fixing to ensure consistent mana production and casting of powerful spells. Ultimately, the strategy revolves around overwhelming opponents with fast combos and powerful creatures while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on combining the abilities of Atraxa, Grand Unifier with powerful creatures like Elesh Norn and Griselbrand, using cards like Ephemerate and Goryo's Vengeance to cheat them into play. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo. By reanimating creatures with instant-speed spells and controlling the board with removal, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. The deck's mana base ensures smooth gameplay and consistency in executing its game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Phlage, Quantum Riddler, and Ragavan, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Solitude and Teferi, Time Raveler. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending, while also maintaining card advantage with Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines and Wrath of the Skies provide powerful finishers, and the mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck combines aggression and disruption to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggro strategy utilizing artifacts and affinity synergies. It aims to flood the board with cheap creatures like Memnite and Ornithopter, while also utilizing cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke to control the board. Urza's Saga is a key card that can tutor for artifact lands and crucial artifacts like Mox Opal. The deck also includes disruption with Tormod's Crypt and Sink into Stupor. With a strong mana base and a mix of aggression and control elements, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

This deck revolves around using Song of Creation to draw and play multiple spells each turn, while utilizing various artifacts and cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate mana and card advantage. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces for a powerful combo finish, whether it be through Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Grapeshot. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt to control the board and disrupt opponent's strategies, while also having additional card draw and filtering with Preordain and Mishra's Bauble.

The UR Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced aggression using cheap creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to clear a path to victory. Mishra's Bauble and Preordain help to dig for more threats or answers quickly, while cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter provide additional pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck aims to efficiently use creatures such as Allosaurus Rider, Generous Ent, and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant to quickly ramp up mana and summon powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand. The deck utilizes a variety of spells to protect its creatures and ensure the combo goes off smoothly, such as Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer. With cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform, the deck can quickly tutor for the necessary combo pieces. Overall, the key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on assembling powerful combos with Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to generate explosive mana and land drops. It utilizes cards like Arboreal Grazer, Lotus Field, and Gruul Turf to ramp up quickly and efficiently. The main win conditions include Primeval Titan fetching powerful lands like Crumbling Vestige and the use of Scapeshift to search for key lands or create a lethal landfall trigger. The deck also includes various utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to enhance its overall strategy and provide flexibility in different matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to generate a large amount of mana and either search for key combo pieces or overwhelm the opponent with a massive board presence. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige helps to further accelerate the mana production, while Boseiju, Who Endures provides protection for important combo spells. The deck utilizes land synergy and manipulation to execute its game plan efficiently.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with a mix of strong creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge to finish off opponents. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah serves as a powerful finisher, while cards like Voice of Victory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional utility. The deck also includes disruption elements like Seasoned Pyromancer and Solitude to control the board and protect its threats.

The deck focuses on quickly generating early game pressure and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By curving out creatures like Ragavan and Ocelot Pride, and using burn spells and combat tricks to clear the way, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional threats and resilience against removal, while cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Arena of Glory help to maintain card advantage and board presence.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures, burn spells, and disruption. With a focus on aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, coupled with powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Guide of Souls, this deck aims to close out games quickly. With support from burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm, as well as disruption tools like Blood Moon and Static Prison, this deck is designed to apply early pressure and maintain board control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building up advantage through card draw and efficient threats. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with their threats and maintaining card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game once control is established.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while simultaneously applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using disruptive spells like Prismatic Ending and Force of Negation, along with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Solitude, the deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options. The creatures in the deck, such as Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, provide a fast clock and can quickly close out the game. Additionally, cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Teferi, Time Raveler offer card advantage and tempo advantage to stay ahead in the game.

This deck focuses on quickly getting key creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. Atraxa, Grand Unifier is a powerful threat that can benefit from being reanimated, while cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler provide utility and disruption. The deck also includes a small reanimation package with cards like Solitude and Faithful Mending. The deck features a mix of interaction and combo pieces to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own powerful reanimation combos.

This deck focuses on aggressively disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure to finish the game quickly. By combining cards that disrupt your opponent's resources with powerful creatures and removal spells, you aim to disrupt their strategy while putting them on a clock. Cards like Phelia and Phlage provide early threats, while Quantum Riddler and Solitude disrupt your opponent's plays. Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect your creatures and control the tempo of the game. Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide card advantage and versatility. The deck aims to win through a combination of creature beats and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory. It includes a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and powerful spells like Wrath of the Skies to control the board and pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors while including utility lands like Arena of Glory. The main goal is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's gameplan, and finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck looks to disrupt opponents' strategies while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. Using a mix of removal spells and disruptive permanents like Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to control the game and secure victory through combat damage. The creatures also provide some card advantage and ways to protect key pieces. The land base is optimized for consistent mana access and making the most of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Consign to Memory. With a mix of control and aggressive elements, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure a win.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying early pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes a mix of removal spells and disruptive creatures like Phelia and Quantum Riddler to control the board and slow down the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage and Ragavan to quickly close out the game. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and protection for your creatures. The deck aims to outpace the opponent by efficiently using its resources and disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a board of small artifacts and using them to generate mana and card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal. This allows the deck to quickly build a presence on the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt to deal with opposing strategies. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for key artifacts, while cards like Metallic Rebuke and Sink into Stupor help control the game.

This deck focuses on deploying multiple artifact creatures quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large board presence early in the game, supported by efficient card draw through cards like Thoughtcast. Engineered Explosives provides removal while Metallic Rebuke offers a way to protect the board. Urza's Saga is a key card in generating additional artifact tokens and searching for key artifacts. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and apply pressure through aggressive plays.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells, while also utilizing the UrzaTron lands to ramp up to them quickly. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with Thought-Knot Seer and Kozilek's Command, while also using Karn, the Great Creator to shut down artifact-based strategies. The combination of powerful creatures like Sire of Seven Deaths and Ugin, Eye of the Storms, along with removal spells like Dismember and Warping Wail, makes this deck a formidable force in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.
